title: Zubeen Garg death: Singer was drunk, took off life vest, Singapore court told
description: Assamese music icon Zubeen Garg drowned off Singapore's Lazarus Island while heavily intoxicated, a coroner's court heard. Toxicology revealed hypertension and epilepsy medication, but no other drugs. Singapore police suspect no foul play, while Assam authorities pursue murder charges against seven individuals, citing financial motives. The inquiry aims to clarify the circumstances of Garg's death.

title: How Delhi’s failure to house homeless hides behind numbers; 20k beds in files
description: Delhi's official records boast nearly 20,000 beds for the homeless, yet ground checks reveal a stark reality of significantly fewer available spots. Many shelters operate at a fraction of their claimed capacity, with a severe shortage of beds and mattresses. This discrepancy leaves thousands without adequate shelter, despite government assurances and a persistent problem over years.

description: Meta's new structure reveals tension between Mark Zuckerberg and Alexandr Wang, the $14 billion AI recruit. A recent strategy clash highlighted differing priorities, with Wang pushing for cutting-edge AI over immediate product integration.

title: Uddhav Thackeray faces make-or-break BMC elections; challenges ahead for Shiv Sena (UBT)
Trump who? At $1.2tn, China's trade surplus hits new high in 2025 - despite US tariffs
description: US-bound shipments did fall sharply after Donald Trump raised duties in 2025. But under Xi Jinping's guidance, Chinese exporters responded with speed and ingenuity. Sales surged instead to Southeast Asia, Africa, Latin America and Europe. In many cases, goods were routed through third countries, blunting the effect of US tariffs altogether.

title: Amazon's RTO gets stricter: Managers tracking hours; three types of employees under scanner
description: Amazon is now closely monitoring office attendance, tracking not just presence but also exact hours spent by corporate employees. This escalation in surveillance, revealed by an internal document, flags 'Low-Time Badgers' and 'Zero Badgers' who don't meet in-office expectations. The move follows a strict five-day return-to-office mandate, with similar tracking systems emerging at tech rivals like Samsung and Dell.

title: 'Her family warned her': Gisele Bündchen’s family favored Tom Brady over Valente
description: Gisele Bündchen’s family is reportedly uneasy about her marriage to Joaquim Valente, with Tom Brady still serving as a point of comparison. Sources claim relatives worry about financial imbalance and potential prenup loopholes, despite the couple’s happiness and growing family. While Bündchen appears confident in her choice, those closest to her remain cautious about long term security.
